content: Equities Securities ETF Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 28 Mar 2019If an ETF is based on a set of underlying stocks, why does it's value fluctuate differently then the underlying set?1 answerAnswerBump0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 29 Mar 2019Because an ETF cannot track the index with 100% accuracy. There are fees involved, tracking errors, dividends paid out etc0 comments0
